reading: Practice empathy by understanding character motivations
Use books to explore different perspectives
math: Practice patience when problems are challenging
Use problem-solving steps for math word problems
Celebrate effort and growth, not just correct answers
science: Develop persistence when experiments don't work
art: Practice accepting when art doesn't turn out as expected

regulation_practice_schedule.description: Take 3 deep breaths and notice how your body feels
Practice calm breathing before starting something new or difficult
One deep breath between activities to stay centered
Notice current emotions and use regulation tools if needed

coaching_reminders: Remember the problem-solving steps: Stop, Talk, Listen, Try Again
Listen to understand, not to argue
Look for solutions that work for everyone
success_indicators: Uses words instead of physical responses
Shows empathy for other person's perspective

empathy_opportunities.description: Discuss how characters in stories might be feeling
coaching_questions: How do you think this character is feeling?
Why might they feel that way?
What would you want if you were in their situation?

empathy_opportunities.description: Notice and respond to friends' emotions during play
coaching_questions: How does your friend seem to be feeling?
How can you show you care about their feelings?

empathy_opportunities.description: Look for chances to help or show kindness to others
coaching_questions: How can you help someone who seems to need it?
What would make someone feel better in this situation?
How does it feel when someone is kind to you?

evening_reflection_prompts: What emotions did you notice in yourself today?
How did you handle challenging moments?
What are you proud of from today?
How did you show kindness to others?
When did you use your calm-down strategies?
How well did your regulation tools work?
